How are stems of trees different from the stems of herbs?
options: Tree stems are underground; herb stems are above ground.
Tree stems are green; herb stems are brown.
Tree stems are non-woody; herb stems are woody.
Tree stems are thick and woody; herb stems are thin and green.
questions.answer: Tree stems are thick and woody; herb stems are thin and green.

questions.question: What are cereals? Give two examples.
options: Cereals are grains like wheat and rice.
Cereals are spices like pepper and turmeric.
Cereals are fruits like apple and banana.
Cereals are vegetables like carrot and beetroot.
questions.answer: Cereals are grains like wheat and rice.

questions.question: What are spices? Give two examples.
options: Spices are oils like mustard and coconut.
Spices are nuts like almond and cashew.
Spices are flavoring agents like cinnamon and cardamom.
Spices are beverages like tea and coffee.
questions.answer: Spices are flavoring agents like cinnamon and cardamom.

questions.question: Name three plants that are used to make medicines.
What is a creeper?
options: A plant that climbs with support of walls.
A plant that grows along the ground due to weak stems.
A plant with many thin woody stems near the ground.
A big plant with thick woody stem.
questions.answer: A plant that grows along the ground due to weak stems.

options: The process by which a seed grows into a new plant
The loss of water from leaves

questions.question: Stomata are:
options: Tiny openings on leaves for gas exchange
questions.answer: Tiny openings on leaves for gas exchange

questions.question: What is a taproot?
options: A root system with one main root and smaller side roots
A root system with many similar-sized roots
questions.answer: A root system with one main root and smaller side roots

A seed that does not germinate

questions.answer: A seed with one seed leaf

questions.question: Which of the following best describes a difference between a chair and a man?
options: A chair can breathe, a man cannot
A man can move on his own, a chair cannot
A chair needs food, a man does not
questions.answer: A man can move on his own, a chair cannot

questions.question: How is a toy baby different from a real baby?
options: A toy baby can grow, a real baby cannot
A real baby needs food, a toy baby does not
Both can feel changes around them
A toy baby can breathe, a real baby cannot
questions.answer: A real baby needs food, a toy baby does not

questions.question: Which of the following distinguishes animals from plants?
options: Plants can move from place to place
Animals can make their own food
Animals can move independently, plants cannot
questions.answer: Animals can move independently, plants cannot

questions.question: How are living things different from non-living things?
options: Living things do not need food
Living things can grow and reproduce
Non-living things can move on their own
questions.answer: Living things can grow and reproduce

questions.answer: A tree needs water, a toy does not

questions.question: Which of the following is a basic feature of living things?
options: They do not feel changes around them

questions.question: Living things feel changes around them, while non-living things do not. This means that:
options: Non-living things can respond to touch

questions.answer: Living things can sense their environment
